SEARCH

Loops Java SDK 1.0-SNAPSHOT

Loops Java SDK

A type-safe Java SDK for the Loops.so API, providing full API coverage for contacts, events, transactional emails, mailing lists, and custom properties.

Features

  • Full API Coverage - Supports all Loops.so API endpoints
  • Async Support - Both synchronous and asynchronous (CompletableFuture) methods
  • Type-Safe - Leverages Java records for immutable, type-safe data models
  • Resilient - Built-in retry logic for rate limiting
  • Modern Java - Built for Java 21+

Quick Start


// Initialize the client
LoopsClient client = LoopsClient.builder()
        .apiKey("your-api-key")
        .build();

// Create a contact
ContactResponse response = client.contacts().create(
    ContactCreateRequest.builder()
        .email("user@example.com")
        .firstName("John")
        .lastName("Doe")
        .build()
);

// Send an event
EventResponse eventResponse = client.events().send(
    EventRequest.builder()
        .email("user@example.com")
        .eventName("signed_up")
        .build()
);

// Send a transactional email
TransactionalResponse emailResponse = client.transactional().send(
    TransactionalRequest.builder()
        .transactionalId("welcome_email")
        .email("user@example.com")
        .build()
);

Getting Started

To get started with the Loops Java SDK:

  1. Add the dependency to your project (Maven or Gradle)
  2. Obtain an API key from your Loops.so account
  3. Initialize the LoopsClient with your API key
  4. Use the various client methods to interact with the Loops.so API

Main Components

Core Client

  • LoopsClient - Main entry point for the SDK

API Clients

  • ContactsClient - Manage contacts (create, update, delete, find)
  • EventsClient - Send events to Loops
  • TransactionalClient - Send transactional emails
  • MailingListsClient - Manage mailing lists
  • ContactPropertiesClient - Manage custom contact properties
  • DedicatedIpsClient - Manage dedicated IPs
  • ApiKeyClient - Retrieve API key information

Error Handling

  • LoopsApiException - Base exception for API errors
  • LoopsValidationException - Validation errors
  • RateLimitExceededException - Rate limit errors

Asynchronous Operations

All API methods have asynchronous variants that return CompletableFuture. Asynchronous method names end with "Async": 


// Synchronous
ContactResponse response = client.contacts().create(request);

// Asynchronous
CompletableFuture<ContactResponse> futureResponse =
    client.contacts().createAsync(request);

// Handle the result
futureResponse.thenAccept(response -> {
    System.out.println("Contact created: " + response.id());
});

Requirements

  • Java 21 or higher
  • Maven 3.8+ or Gradle 7.0+

Resources

  • GitHub Repository
  • Loops.so API Documentation

Package
Description
com.telos.loops
Core client for interacting with the Loops.so API.
com.telos.loops.apikey
Client and models for API key validation in the Loops.so API.
com.telos.loops.contacts
Client and models for managing contacts in the Loops.so API.
com.telos.loops.error
Exception classes for error handling in the Loops Java SDK.
com.telos.loops.events
Client and models for sending events to the Loops.so API.
com.telos.loops.ips
Client and models for viewing dedicated IP addresses in the Loops.so API.
com.telos.loops.lists
Client and models for viewing mailing lists in the Loops.so API.
com.telos.loops.model
Common models and shared types used across the Loops Java SDK.
com.telos.loops.properties
Client and models for managing custom contact properties in the Loops.so API.
com.telos.loops.transactional
Client and models for sending and managing transactional emails via the Loops.so API.
com.telos.loops.transport
Transport layer abstraction for HTTP communication in the Loops Java SDK.
